_schema_notes.bundling_rules: Rules that define code bundling behavior (drop_codes, therapeutic_codes). These affect code selection logic.
_schema_notes.cms_rvus: Authoritative CMS RVU data with all components, payments, global periods, and status codes. Updated annually from CMS PFS Final Rule.
_schema_notes.code_lists: All entries are flat arrays of CPT code strings. Use key naming convention: category_subcategory (e.g., bronchoscopic_blvr_chartis).
_schema_notes.master_code_index: Consolidated, year-aware code index (descriptor + attributes + financials). Prefer this for single-source-of-truth lookups; legacy sections remain for backward compatibility.
_schema_notes.ncci_pairs: CMS NCCI edit pairs. primary+secondary are bundled; modifier_allowed indicates if unbundling modifier is permitted.
_schema_notes.qa_rules: Documentation validation rules. These flag missing documentation but do NOT automatically drop codes. Check rule_type='documentation_validation'.
_schema_notes.rvus_sections: Short-form RVU sections (rvus_bronch_pleural_thor, rvus_sedation_em) provide work/PE/MP for quick internal modeling. Use cms_rvus for CMS-validated full data with payments.
_schema_notes.terminology_mappings: Use to normalize user input and generate display labels. Pattern: lowercase(input) → lookup in variations → canonical_key → display_label.

_notes: Anesthesia codes are not paid via MPFS RVU × conversion factor; they use anesthesia base units + time units × anesthesia CF.
Included for completeness / display only unless you add an anesthesia payment model.

coding_rules: Use 31634 only when Chartis/balloon occlusion assessment is performed and bronchial valves are not placed in the same session.
Use 31647 for the initial treated lobe and +31651 for each additional lobe treated with valves.
Use 31648 for removal of valves from the first lobe and +31649 for each additional lobe removed.
BLVR is generally planned as an inpatient DRG; coordinate with hospital utilization management to ensure appropriate status.
Do not report 31634 in conjunction with 31647 or +31651 at the same session.

31640_vs_31641_same_site.description: When tumor excision (31640) and ablation/destruction (31641) occur in the same anatomic site, report only the higher-valued 31641. Use -59/-XS for distinct segments/lobes treated with different modalities.

31641_resection_evidence_preference.description: If 31641 (ablation) is supported and no strong resection/debulking language exists, suppress 31640. Only keep 31640 when explicit excision technique terms are documented.

advanced_sampling_bundles_31622.description: When advanced biopsy/sampling techniques (navigation, TBLB, TBNA, EBUS) are performed, the diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) component is bundled and should not be separately reported.

blvr_valve_lobes.description: For BLVR valve placement, use 31647 for the first treated lobe and +31651 for each additional lobe. For valve removal, use 31648 for the first lobe and +31649 for each additional lobe.

chartis_bundling.description: 31634 (balloon occlusion/Chartis) is intended for stand-alone assessment when bronchial valves are NOT inserted. Do not report 31634 in conjunction with 31647 or +31651 at the same session; balloon occlusion/assessment is included in the valve insertion service.

diagnostic_with_surgical.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled when more extensive therapeutic or biopsy bronchoscopy procedures from the same family are performed by the same physician on the same date of service.

ebus_bundling.description: Avoid double-counting linear and radial EBUS for the same nodal station set or peripheral lesion unless clearly distinct and separately documented sites are sampled.

em_global_period_thoracoscopy.description: For major thoracoscopic procedures with 90-day global periods, postoperative E/M services related to the surgery are generally bundled during the global period. Unrelated problems may be reported with appropriate modifiers (e.g., 24 for unrelated E/M).
em_global_period_thoracoscopy.rationale: AABIP pleural & thoracoscopy webinars: 3260x diagnostic/biopsy series are 0-day global while 3265x pleurodesis/decortication families are 90-day global, affecting postoperative E/M billing.

em_same_day_minor_procedure.description: For 0-day global 'minor' procedures, same-day E/M is typically bundled unless a significant, separately identifiable service is documented. When appropriate, append modifier 25 to the E/M code and ensure that the note clearly supports work beyond the usual pre-procedure H&P and consent.
em_same_day_minor_procedure.rationale: AABIP pleural and general coding webinars: routine pre-procedure evaluation is included in the procedure; same-day E/M requires modifier 25 and separate medical decision-making.

moderate_sedation_time_based.description: Moderate (conscious) sedation is reported with 99152 for the initial 15 minutes of intraservice time and +99153 for each additional 15 minutes. Documentation should include sedation start and stop times, total time, level of sedation, and monitoring, and should identify the independent trained observer when the proceduralist bills the sedation.
moderate_sedation_time_based.rationale: AABIP coding webinars: moderate sedation codes (99152/+99153) are time-based and underused in IP; require explicit time documentation and an independent observer when the bronchoscopist reports sedation.

pdt_single_code_31641.description: When the note clearly documents photodynamic therapy without independent stent placement, cryotherapy, or debulking, report only 31641 for the bronchoscopic destruction work. Other therapeutic bronchoscopy codes should be suppressed unless separate, non-PDT interventions are explicitly documented.

pleural_drainage_vs_thoracoscopy.description: CPT 32551 (tube thoracostomy) is a 'separate procedure' and is not separately reportable when performed through the same incision as an open or thoracoscopic thoracic procedure on the same side; it may be reported when contralateral or clearly unrelated.

pleural_post_procedure_imaging.description: Post-procedure chest x-rays performed solely to evaluate tube or fluid status after thoracentesis, IPC placement, or chest tube placement are generally bundled and not separately reportable.

pleurodesis_with_thoracoscopy.description: Chemical pleurodesis agent instillation (32560) is bundled into thoracoscopic pleurodesis (32650) and is not separately reportable.

radial_linear_exclusive.description: Radial EBUS is generally not reported with linear EBUS unless targeting distinct peripheral lesion.

radial_requires_tblb.description: Radial EBUS add-on (+31654) requires TBLB (31628/+31632) or documented peripheral lesion target.
radial_requires_tblb.error_message: Radial EBUS (+31654) is not billable without a peripheral intervention (e.g., TBLB 31628/+31632 or peripheral TBNA 31629/+31633).

sedation_with_separate_anesthesia.description: Do not report 99152/+99153 when a separate anesthesia professional bills anesthesia services for the same procedure (e.g., general anesthesia or MAC); sedation is included in the anesthesia service.
sedation_with_separate_anesthesia.rationale: General CMS anesthesia/sedation policy and AABIP discussions: moderate sedation codes are not reported by the proceduralist when anesthesia professionals provide and bill for anesthesia.

stent_dilation_same_segment.description: Dilation of the same tracheal/bronchial segment as stent placement is bundled into the stent code. Use -59/-XS only if clearly distinct segments are dilated.

tbna_with_ebus_tbna.description: When conventional TBNA and EBUS-TBNA target the same nodal stations, report only the EBUS codes (31652/31653). Report both only when truly distinct nodal groups are sampled with each technique.

thoracentesis_with_ipc.description: Initial placement of an indwelling tunneled pleural catheter includes the access to the pleural space; do not separately report thoracentesis at the same session on the same side.

thoracoscopy_biopsy_with_resection.description: Diagnostic lung biopsy of tissue that is subsequently removed as part of a more extensive thoracoscopic resection in the same anatomic location is not separately reportable.

thoracoscopy_converted_to_open.description: When a surgical thoracoscopy is converted to an open thoracotomy during the same encounter, the thoracoscopy is not separately reportable in addition to the open procedure.

thoracoscopy_diagnostic_with_surgical.description: Diagnostic thoracoscopy on the same side is bundled when a thoracoscopic surgical procedure is performed in the same session; report only the more extensive surgical thoracoscopy code unless a staged diagnostic procedure led to a separate open operation.

thoracoscopy_supersedes_pleural_drainage.description: When therapeutic medical thoracoscopy (32650) with pleural biopsies is documented, prior pleural drainage codes (32554/32555/32557/32560) on the same side/session are bundled and should be dropped.

tube_thoracostomy_separate_procedure.description: Tube thoracostomy 32551 is designated as a 'separate procedure' and is not separately reportable when performed through the same incision and on the same side as another open thoracic procedure.

_notes: RVU values extracted from CMS PFS Relative Value Files (PPRRVU).
Payments = Total RVU × Conversion Factor (national, unadjusted).
Add-on codes have global_days="ZZZ" and are stored with a leading "+" in this section.
cms_rvus._source: CMS 2026 National PFS Relative Value File (January Release)

notes: Values are 2025 Medicare national averages, non-geographically adjusted.

These values are authoritative for payment estimation when conflicts exist with other sections.

changelog: v3.0: Updated cms_rvus from CMS CY2026 PPRRVU January release (PPRRVU2026_Jan_nonQPP.xlsx; PPRRVU2026_Jan_QPP.xlsx); set CF non-QP=$33.4009, QP=$33.5675; cleaned hcpcs to alphanumeric-only; added 32662 to thoracoscopy_surgical; replaced deleted 33015 with pericardial_drainage 33017-33019; refreshed fee_schedules RVU/payment fields to CY2026.
v2.8: Added CPT 32650 (thoracoscopic pleurodesis); updated 32609 (medical thoracoscopy pleural biopsy) with OPPS data; CMS CY2025 CF=$32.3562
v2.7: Updated RVU values from CMS 2025 PFS Final Rule (corrected E/M) on 2025-12-01 (families: all)
v2.6: Flattened code_lists structure; separated QA rules from bundling rules; added terminology_mappings for display normalization
v2.5: Updated RVU values from CMS 2025 PFS Final Rule on 2025-12-01
v2.4: Reconciled RVU conflicts between sections; consolidated duplicate synonym lists; added missing add-on codes; expanded NCCI pairs; fixed typos; standardized formatting
v2.9: Added missing codes from registry review (32997, 32662, 33015, 32602, 76604)

deprecations.reason: Filename aligned to semantic version; old name retained as a compatibility alias.

metadata.label: ip_coding_billing.v3.0
notes: Local IP coding/billing knowledge base for decision support and NLP.
CPT/RVU content summarized from vendor reimbursement guides; verify against current CMS source files before financial planning.
This file is not an official CMS/AMA document.
When RVU values conflict between sources, fee_schedules values from vendor guides take precedence for payment estimates; rvus section provides simplified reference values.

source_documents.aabip_webinars: AABIP coding and billing webinars combined.txt
source_documents.pulmonary_quick_reference_2017: 2017 Pulmonary Coding and Payment Quick Reference.pdf

documentation_requirements: Explicit description of what made the service unusually difficult or prolonged
Objective data if available (fluoroscopy time, number of stents/valves, extensive adhesions, etc.)
Comparison to typical procedure time or complexity
22.label: Increased procedural services
typical_use: Very prolonged or technically complex bronchoscopy or thoracoscopy

24.label: Unrelated E/M service during postoperative period
notes: Use for E/M services during a 90-day global period that are unrelated to the original surgery.
Documentation must clearly indicate the new or separate problem.

25.label: Significant, separately identifiable E/M on same day as procedure
notes: Use when a same-day clinic or consult visit is truly distinct from the procedure decision itself.
Do not use 25 just to justify pre-procedure H&P when the purpose of the visit is the procedure.
Documentation must support medical decision-making beyond routine pre-procedure evaluation.

26.label: Professional component
notes: Use for interpretation of imaging studies when you do not own the technical component.
Not applicable to most bronchoscopy or thoracoscopy procedures.

50.label: Bilateral procedure
notes: Applicable to bilateral thoracoscopy when performed through separate incisions.
Check individual code descriptions for bilateral reporting rules.

52.label: Reduced services
notes: Requires documentation that the reduced service was elective (not discontinued for patient safety).
Do not use when procedure was discontinued for patient safety; use -53 instead.
typical_use: Procedure started but partially completed electively
Navigation initiated but lesion not reached

53.label: Discontinued procedure
notes: Document the clinical reason for aborting.
Use for patient safety discontinuation, not elective partial procedures.
typical_use: Procedure aborted for patient safety after anesthesia and prep
Hemodynamic instability or hypoxia requiring termination

57.label: Decision for surgery
notes: Use for E/M service on same day as decision to perform major surgery (90-day global).
Applicable when thoracoscopic procedure is decided upon during the same-day evaluation.

documentation_requirements: Explicitly document different anatomic sites (e.g., RUL vs LLL, or distinct segment names)
Clearly state that the procedures were separate and distinct
59.label: Distinct procedural service
typical_use: To unbundle NCCI-paired bronchoscopy services done in clearly different anatomic sites
Dilation of a separate lobe from where a stent was placed
31640 and 31641 when different segments/lobes are treated with different modalities
59.xepd_alternative: Consider XE/XS/XP/XU modifiers as more specific alternatives when applicable

76.label: Repeat procedure by same physician
notes: Use for repeat bronchoscopy or pleural procedure by the same physician on the same day.

77.label: Repeat procedure by another physician
notes: Use for repeat procedure by a different physician on the same day.

XE.label: Separate encounter
notes: NCCI-associated modifier for distinct encounters on the same day.

XP.label: Separate practitioner
notes: NCCI-associated modifier for services by different practitioners.

XS.label: Separate structure
notes: NCCI-associated modifier for distinct anatomic structures.
Preferred over -59 when anatomic distinction is the basis for unbundling.

XU.label: Unusual non-overlapping service
notes: NCCI-associated modifier for services that do not overlap despite apparent bundling.

_notes: MUEs (Medically Unlikely Edits) vary by payer and change over time; keep current from CMS MUE releases.
This section is intended for internal QA guardrails (unit-limit warnings), not definitive billing guidance.

ncci_pairs.reason: Dilation in a different airway segment than stent placement may be separately reportable with -59/-XS if clearly distinct and medically necessary; otherwise bundled into stent work.
When tracheal stent placement and airway dilation occur in distinct locations, modifier -59/-XS may allow separate reporting; same-site dilation is bundled.
Endobronchial aspiration and TBNA in the same segment are usually bundled; use modifier -59/-XS only when they are truly separate sites or indications.
Tumor excision and ablation in the same site are bundled; 31640 may be reported with -59/-XS only if a separate lesion in a distinct segment/lobe is excised.
31634 (Chartis/balloon occlusion) is bundled when performed in the same lobe as BLVR valve placement (31647/31651); modifier -59/-XS may allow separate reporting when distinct lobes are documented.
EBUS-TBNA and conventional TBNA targeting the same nodal stations are bundled; report only the EBUS code. Use -59/-XS only when truly distinct nodal groups are sampled.
EBUS-TBNA (3+ stations) and conventional TBNA targeting the same nodal stations are bundled. Use -59/-XS only for distinct nodal groups sampled with different techniques.
Therapeutic aspiration is bundled into EBUS-TBNA (1-2 stations). Aspiration performed during EBUS is inherent to the procedure and not separately reportable.
Subsequent therapeutic aspiration is bundled into EBUS-TBNA (1-2 stations). Aspiration performed during EBUS is inherent to the procedure.
Therapeutic aspiration is bundled into EBUS-TBNA (3+ stations). Aspiration performed during EBUS is inherent to the procedure and not separately reportable.
Subsequent therapeutic aspiration is bundled into EBUS-TBNA (3+ stations). Aspiration performed during EBUS is inherent to the procedure.
TBLB and TBNA of the same lesion are typically bundled; use -59/-XS only when clearly distinct lesions/locations are sampled.
Tube thoracostomy (separate procedure) is not separately reportable when performed via the same approach as therapeutic thoracoscopy on the same side.
Post-thoracentesis chest x-ray performed solely to check for pneumothorax or fluid status is generally bundled.
Initial placement of an indwelling tunneled pleural catheter includes the access to the pleural space; do not separately report thoracentesis at the same session on the same side.
When a tunneled pleural catheter is placed, a same-session ultrasound-guided thoracentesis via that access is considered part of the catheter procedure and is not separately reportable.

Tube thoracostomy and thoracentesis on the same side are generally bundled unless the note supports a distinct access/site or staged service; an appropriate NCCI-associated modifier may be used in rare circumstances.
Diagnostic thoracoscopy on the same side is bundled into thoracoscopic pleurodesis or other surgical thoracoscopy performed at the same session.
Chemical pleurodesis agent instillation performed through operative chest tubes is inherent to thoracoscopic pleurodesis and not separately reportable.

Tube thoracostomy described as a separate procedure is not separately reportable when performed through the same incision as an open thoracotomy; consider a modifier only if contralateral or clearly distinct.
Post-procedure chest x-ray following pleural drainage catheter placement is bundled when performed to confirm position or exclude pneumothorax.
Post-procedure chest x-ray following pleural drainage is bundled when performed solely to confirm adequacy of drainage.
Diagnostic thoracoscopy with biopsy is bundled into therapeutic thoracoscopic pleurodesis when performed on the same side in the same session.
Tumor destruction/ablation and dilation in the same segment are typically bundled; dilation may be separately reported only when performed on a distinct airway segment.
Stent revision typically includes any necessary dilation; separate dilation reporting requires distinct anatomic site documentation.

TBLB (31628) and endobronchial biopsy (31625) on the SAME lesion are typically bundled; append -59/-XS only when clearly distinct lesions/airway sites are biopsied and documentation supports separate work.

TBNA (31629) and endobronchial biopsy (31625) on the SAME lesion are typically bundled; append -59/-XS only when clearly distinct lesions/airway sites are sampled and documentation supports separate work.

pathology_knowledge._description: Regex/lexicon for histology and molecular markers in pathology reports. Deterministic-only; used to populate registry.pathology_results.*

32550.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff

32551.description: Tube thoracostomy, includes water seal or suction, when performed (separate procedure)

32552.description: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff

32554.description: Thoracentesis, needle or catheter, aspiration of pleural space, without imaging guidance

32555.description: Thoracentesis, needle or catheter, aspiration of pleural space, with imaging guidance
32555.imaging_note: Imaging guidance (ultrasound) is included when performed; do not separately report 76942

32556.description: Pleural drainage with insertion of indwelling catheter, without imaging guidance

32557.description: Pleural drainage with insertion of indwelling catheter, with imaging guidance
32557.imaging_note: Imaging guidance is included when performed; do not separately report 76942

bundled_chest_radiology_terms: post chest tube placement chest x-ray
post_procedure_imaging.ncci_note: Post-procedure chest radiology following thoracentesis or chest tube placement is generally bundled and not separately reportable unless a distinct clinical indication is documented.

32601.description: Thoracoscopy, diagnostic, lungs, pericardium, mediastinal or pleural space, without biopsy

32606.description: Thoracoscopy, diagnostic; with mediastinal lymph node biopsy

32607.description: Thoracoscopy; with diagnostic wedge resection, unilateral, single or multiple

32608.description: Thoracoscopy; with diagnostic wedge resection, bilateral, single or multiple

32651.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with partial pulmonary decortication

32652.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with total pulmonary decortication

32653.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with removal of intrapleural foreign body or fibrin deposit

32654.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with control of traumatic hemorrhage

32666.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with therapeutic wedge resection, initial, unilateral

32669.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with removal of a single lung segment (segmentectomy)

31634_hemorrhage_control.description: When the focus is hemoptysis control with hemostatic maneuvers (balloon occlusion, iced saline, epi/TXA instillation), add 31634. Drop 31654 or 31615 unless separate navigation or foreign body removal work is clearly documented.
31634_hemorrhage_control.rationale: Ensures hemoptysis control work is captured while preventing double-counting with navigation or foreign body codes that were not truly performed.

31640_requires_excision.description: 31640 should be supported only when the note documents true excision/debulking techniques. Pure ablation language without resection terms should default to 31641.
31640_requires_excision.rationale: Reduces false-positive 31640 coding when only ablation modalities are performed.

32550_requires_new_tunneled_catheter.description: Include 32550 only when an indwelling tunneled catheter is actually inserted (tunnel creation, cuff placement). Planning language without actual placement should not trigger 32550.
32550_requires_new_tunneled_catheter.rationale: Reduces false-positive coding when tunneled catheter placement is only considered.

notes: 31634 may be reported when Chartis/balloon occlusion assessment is performed and bronchial valves are NOT implanted in that session.
Do not report 31634 in conjunction with 31647 or +31651 at the same session (valve codes include balloon occlusion/assessment when performed).

cryobiopsy_not_cryotherapy.logic: When cryo language is paired with biopsy/specimen wording, favor 31628. When cryo is described as therapeutic application to a lesion without specimen collection, favor 31635.
cryobiopsy_not_cryotherapy.radial_link: If cryobiopsy is performed with radial EBUS localization, ensure +31654 logic (radial_requires_tblb) fires to capture the add-on.
cryobiopsy_not_cryotherapy.rationale: Prevents coding cryotherapy ablation when the clinical intent was diagnostic cryobiopsy and vice versa.

em_decision_for_major_procedure.description: For 90-day global thoracoscopic procedures, an E/M visit on the same date that results in the decision to operate may be reported separately with modifier -57; other same-day pre-op evaluation is included in the global surgical package.

em_same_day.description: Same-day E/M with a 0-day global procedure is allowed when documentation supports a significant, separately identifiable service beyond the usual pre-procedure evaluation. Append modifier 25 to the E/M code when reporting.
notes: Routine pre-procedure H&P, consent, and immediate post-procedure check are packaged into the procedure.
Check local payer rules for consult codes or when E/M plus procedure on the same date of service may be downcoded or denied.

policies.global_periods_pleural_vs_thoracoscopy: Thoracentesis and pleural catheter procedures (32554-32557, 32560-32562, 32550-32552) typically have 0-day global periods. Thoracoscopy families differ: diagnostic/biopsy thoracoscopy (3260x series) is usually 0-day global while many thoracoscopic pleurodesis/decortication procedures (3265x series) are 90-day global. Post-op E/M within the global period is bundled when related to the surgery.
policies.ipc_fluid_removal_follow_up: After placement of a tunneled pleural catheter (32550), routine outpatient fluid drainage through the existing catheter is usually captured by appropriate E/M codes rather than repeat pleural drainage CPT codes; 32552 is reserved for surgical removal of the tunneled catheter with cuff, not for routine drainage or noncuffed catheter removal.

documentation_requirements: Identity/role of independent observer when billed by proceduralist

policies.moderate_sedation_documentation: Sedation documentation should include medication(s), route, start and stop times, monitoring data, level of consciousness, and explicit mention of an independent trained observer whose sole job is monitoring the patient during sedation.

multiple_endoscopy_rule.description: For Medicare MPFS multiple endoscopy families (Multiple Procedure indicator=3), payment is made at 100% for the highest-valued endoscopy in the family. Each additional endoscopy in the SAME family is reimbursed at the incremental difference between that code and the family's base endoscopy (for bronchoscopy, base=31622). The base endoscopy is not separately payable when another family member is billed. Add-on codes (global='ZZZ' / indicator=0) are not subject to the multiple endoscopy reduction.
multiple_endoscopy_rule.reference: CMS MPFS Multiple Procedure Indicator descriptors (indicator=3) + MAC guidance: base endoscopy used to calculate the differential reimbursement for related endoscopies.

navigation_packaging_facility.description: Under 2024-2025 OPPS, navigation and additional lobe add-ons are packaged (status N) and do not generate separate facility payment, but they remain separately reportable and payable under the MPFS.

pleural_global_rules.description: Most pleural drainage and IPC/chest tube procedures have 0-day globals; diagnostic thoracoscopy is 0-day; therapeutic thoracoscopy with pleurodesis/decortication/resection typically carries a 90-day global period.

pleurodesis_32560_without_new_catheter.description: When pleurodesis is performed through an existing tube without placement of a new tunneled catheter, report 32560 only and suppress 32550.
pleurodesis_32560_without_new_catheter.rationale: Avoids double-coding when a pleurodesis agent is instilled via existing drainage access.

policies.post_procedure_imaging_policy: For thoracentesis, pleural drainage, and chest tube insertion (32554-32557, 32550, 32551), routine post-procedure chest radiography (e.g., 71045, 71046) performed to confirm tube position or exclude pneumothorax is considered integral to the procedure and is generally not separately reportable under NCCI policy.
policies.sedation_same_provider_policy: When the same physician performs both the bronchoscopy/pleural procedure and provides moderate sedation, use 99151-99153 when allowed. If a different qualified professional provides sedation, use 99155-99157 as appropriate. Many facility and payer contracts bundle sedation, so payment policy should be confirmed locally.

stent_maintenance_31645.description: Routine stent maintenance (cleaning/suctioning, visual inspection) without stent repositioning or exchange supports 31645.
stent_maintenance_31645.rationale: Distinguishes stent maintenance from revision/exchange work.

stent_revision_31646_only_with_change.description: Report 31638 only when the note documents actual stent revision/exchange/repositioning. If documentation only describes cleaning/suctioning with no stent manipulation, suppress 31638 and keep therapeutic aspiration (31645/31646) as appropriate.
stent_revision_31646_only_with_change.rationale: Ensures revision/exchange code is used only when the stent is adjusted or replaced.

tpt_c1601_policy.description: C1601 is paid as a device pass-through amount in addition to the J1 APC payment for eligible bronchoscopy procedures.
notes: Hospitals must report both the primary CPT and C1601; device offset is applied to avoid double payment.
TPT lasts for three years from approval; always confirm current status.

qa_rules._description: Quality assurance rules for documentation validation. These rules check for required documentation elements but do NOT automatically drop or bundle codes. Use these to flag incomplete documentation for review.
qa_rules._usage: For each rule, check if the required documentation elements are present. If missing, flag for QA review rather than rejecting the code.

navigation_required.description: Navigation add-on payable only when image-guided navigation was actually used and the catheter was advanced under navigation toward a target lesion.

radial_requires_peripheral_sampling.description: Radial EBUS add-on requires documentation of a peripheral lesion, radial ultrasound localization (e.g., concentric view, tool-in-lesion), and actual sampling.

rvus._notes: Simplified reference RVUs for quick lookup. For authoritative payment values, use fee_schedules section.

rvus_pleural._notes: Pleural and thoracoscopy procedure RVUs. PE values are facility-based.

rvus_sedation_em._notes: Moderate sedation and E/M code RVUs.

terminology_mappings._description: Canonical mappings between internal keys, display labels, and common variations. Use these to normalize terminology across systems.
terminology_mappings._usage: To normalize: lowercase input, strip whitespace, look up in 'variations' to find 'canonical_key', then use 'display_label' for UI.
